aws::graph::propositions: # Flight Incident Information
The flight involved a VFR pattern final approach.
The pilot attempted remediation/recovery during the flight.
The flight involved a VFR go-around.
Loss of lift was the defining event of the incident.
The flight ended with a collision with terrain/object (non-CFIT).
The pilot held a Private certificate.
The pilot was 65 years old.
The pilot had Single-engine land and Multi-engine land airplane ratings.
The pilot occupied the front seat.
The pilot had no other aircraft ratings.
The pilot used a 4-point restraint.
The pilot had an Instrument Rating for Airplane.
A second pilot was present during the flight.
The pilot had no instructor ratings.
No toxicology was performed on the pilot.
The pilot held a Class 3 medical certification with waivers/limitations.
The pilot's last FAA medical exam was on September 18, 2014.
The pilot was not an occupational pilot.
The pilot's last flight review or equivalent was on October 16, 2012.
The pilot had 551 total flight hours in all aircraft.
The pilot had 3 hours in this make and model of aircraft.
The pilot had 478 hours as Pilot In Command in all aircraft.
The pilot had 14 flight hours in the last 90 days in all aircraft.
The pilot had 4 flight hours in the last 30 days in all aircraft.
The flight instructor held Airline transport, Commercial, and Flight instructor certificates.
The flight instructor was 50 years old.
The flight instructor had Single-engine land and Multi-engine land airplane ratings.
The flight instructor occupied the rear seat.
The flight instructor had no other aircraft ratings.
The flight instructor had an Instrument Rating for Airplane.
The flight instructor was the second pilot present during the flight.
The flight instructor had Airplane multi-engine, Airplane single-engine, and Instrument airplane instructor ratings.
No toxicology was performed on the flight instructor.
The flight instructor held a Class 2 medical certification with waivers/limitations.
The flight instructor's last FAA medical exam was on June 30, 2014.
The flight instructor was an occupational pilot.
The flight instructor had 7500 total flight hours in all aircraft.
The flight instructor had 20 hours in this make and model of aircraft.

text:
# Factual Information

## History of Flight
| Approach-VFR pattern final | Attempted remediation/recovery |
| Approach-VFR go-around | Loss of lift (Defining event) |
| Approach-VFR go-around | Collision with terr/obj (non-CFIT) |

## Pilot Information
| Certificate: | Private |
| Age: | 65 |
| Airplane Rating(s): | Single-engine land; Multi-engine land |
| Seat Occupied: | Front |
| Other Aircraft Rating(s): | None |
| Restraint Used: | 4-point |
| Instrument Rating(s): | Airplane |
| Second Pilot Present: | Yes |
| Instructor Rating(s): | None |
| Toxicology Performed: | No |
| Medical Certification: | Class 3 With waivers/limitations |
| Last FAA Medical Exam: | September 18, 2014 |
| Occupational Pilot: | No |
| Last Flight Review or Equivalent: | October 16, 2012 |
| Flight Time: | 551 hours (Total, all aircraft), 3 hours (Total, this make and model), 478 hours (Pilot In Command, all aircraft), 14 hours (Last 90 days, all aircraft), 4 hours (Last 30 days, all aircraft) |

## Flight Instructor Information
| Certificate: | Airline transport; Commercial; Flight instructor |
| Age: | 50 |
| Airplane Rating(s): | Single-engine land; Multi-engine land |
| Seat Occupied: | Rear |
| Other Aircraft Rating(s): | None |
| Restraint Used: |  |
| Instrument Rating(s): | Airplane |
| Second Pilot Present: | Yes |
| Instructor Rating(s): | Airplane multi-engine; Airplane single-engine; Instrument airplane |
| Toxicology Performed: | No |
| Medical Certification: | Class 2 With waivers/limitations |
| Last FAA Medical Exam: | June 30, 2014 |
| Occupational Pilot: | Yes |
| Last Flight Review or Equivalent: |  |
| Flight Time: | 7500 hours (Total, all aircraft), 20 hours (Total, this make and model) |
